themes.comment: Joy despite circumstances

themes.comment: Longing for divine manifestation

themes.name: Deliverance
themes.comment: Freedom from traps

themes.name: Winged Protection
themes.comment: Avian metaphor for care

themes.name: Dual Threats
themes.comment: Multiple sources of danger

themes.name: Divine Armor
themes.comment: Protective equipment imagery

themes.name: Temporal Protection
themes.comment: Round-the-clock security

themes.name: Multiform Threats
themes.comment: Diverse sources of peril

themes.name: Numerical Protection
themes.comment: Quantitative security promise

themes.name: Divine Justice
themes.comment: God's omniscient oversight

themes.name: Impenetrable Safety
themes.comment: Divine boundary setting

themes.name: Personal Refuge
themes.comment: Individualized protection

themes.name: Divine Immunity
themes.comment: Exemption from harm

themes.name: Sacred Space
themes.comment: Temple as refuge

themes.name: Angelological Assurance
themes.comment: The lemma *angelus* (angel) appears in the dative plural (*angelis*), showing their active role in guardianship. The verb *mando* (to command) appears in the perfect tense (*mandavit*), emphasizing God's authoritative protection.

themes.name: Physical Protection
themes.comment: Divine transportation

themes.name: Preventive Care
themes.comment: Protection from stumbling

themes.name: Victory Over Evil
themes.comment: Dominion over dangerous creatures

themes.name: Divine Response
themes.comment: Reciprocal divine action

themes.name: Covenant Relationship
themes.comment: Intimate divine knowledge

themes.name: Prayer Response
themes.comment: Divine attentiveness

themes.name: Divine Presence
themes.comment: Emmanuel theology

themes.name: Dual Blessing
themes.comment: Temporal and eternal benefits

themes.name: Divine Praise
themes.description: Celebration of God's character through worship
themes.comment: Opens with call to praise (*confiteor*) and musical worship (*psallo*), emphasizing joy (*exsultabo*)

themes.name: Musical Worship
themes.comment: Specific instruments (*cithara*) reflect temple worship practices

themes.name: Divine Wisdom
themes.description: Contrast between God's knowledge and human limitation
themes.comment: God's deep (*profundae*) thoughts contrast with foolishness (*stultus*)

themes.name: Righteous Flourishing
themes.comment: Botanical imagery (*cedrus Libani*) symbolizes enduring vitality

themes.name: Divine Justice
themes.comment: Wicked perish (*pereo*) while God's justice (*rectus*) endures

themes.name: Temporal vs Eternal
themes.description: Contrast between transient evil and enduring God
themes.comment: Sinners like grass (*fenum*) vs God's eternity (*in aeternum*)

themes.name: Temple Imagery
themes.description: Sacred space as locus of blessing
themes.comment: Planted (*plantati*) in God's courts (*atriis*)

themes.name: Augustine: True Worship
themes.comment: Augustine connects praise (*confiteor*) with moral uprightness (*rectus*)

themes.name: Augustine: Two Destinies
themes.comment: Wicked scatter (*dispergentur*) while righteous flourish (*florebunt*)

themes.name: Augustine: Spiritual Longevity
themes.comment: Horn (*cornu*) as symbol of strength in later years (*senecta uberi*)

themes.name: Double Beatitude
themes.comment: Opening blessings for law-keepers (v1-2)

themes.name: Wholehearted Seeking
themes.comment: Whole-hearted study of testimonies (v2)

themes.name: Path Contrast
themes.description: Opposing ways of righteousness and wickedness
themes.comment: Negative example of law-breakers (v3)

themes.name: Commandment Imperative
themes.comment: Explicit command to keep statutes (v4)

themes.name: Prayer for Guidance
themes.comment: Desire for paths aligned with God's law (v5)

themes.name: Confident Assurance
themes.comment: Result of comprehensive obedience (v6)

themes.name: Grateful Learning
themes.comment: Commitment to learn judgments (v7)

themes.name: Covenantal Commitment
themes.comment: Resolution not to forsake the law (v8)

themes.name: Spiritual Formation
themes.description: Guidance for the young believer's path
themes.comment: Opening focus on correction and keeping God's words

themes.name: Heart Engagement
themes.comment: Mental and emotional aspects of devotion in middle verses

themes.name: Divine Communication
themes.comment: Multiple terms for God's instructions throughout

themes.name: Delightful Obedience
themes.comment: Positive emotional response in closing verses

themes.name: Vocational Response
themes.comment: Active verbs showing engaged response

themes.name: Augustine: Memory Theater
themes.description: Storing God's word in the heart
themes.comment: Augustinian emphasis on memory as spiritual faculty

themes.name: Augustine: Delightful Discipline
themes.comment: How grace makes God's law desirable

themes.name: Servant Identity
themes.description: The psalmist's self-understanding as God's servant
themes.comment: Repeated servant language with active obedience

themes.name: Divine Illumination
themes.comment: Vision metaphors for Torah comprehension

themes.name: Exilic Longing
themes.comment: Tension between earthly sojourn and divine commandments

themes.name: Opposition Context
themes.description: Conflict with the arrogant and powerful
themes.comment: Social resistance to Torah observance

themes.name: Covenantal Defense
themes.description: Appeal to God's testimonies in adversity
themes.comment: Using God's words as protection against slander

themes.name: Augustine: Two Cities
themes.description: Contrast between heavenly and earthly communities
themes.comment: Earthly powers vs. heavenly citizenship

themes.name: Augustine: Delightful Struggle
themes.comment: How adversity deepens love for God's law

themes.name: Augustine: Ordered Love
themes.description: Proper desire directed toward eternal law
themes.comment: Soul's longing rightly oriented toward God's statutes

themes.name: Mortal Anguish
themes.comment: Physical metaphors for spiritual crisis

themes.name: Divine Rescue
themes.comment: Requests for God to act amid suffering

themes.name: Pedagogy of Suffering
themes.description: Affliction as context for learning God's ways
themes.comment: Educational language in trial context

themes.name: Two Ways Contrast
themes.comment: Classic wisdom literature dichotomy

themes.name: Covenantal Pursuit
themes.comment: Dynamic verbs of spiritual commitment

themes.name: Heart Transformation
themes.comment: God's role in shaping human will

themes.name: Augustine: Humble Learning
themes.description: Brokenness as prerequisite for divine instruction
themes.comment: Contrast between human lowliness and divine teaching

themes.name: Augustine: Dilated Heart
themes.comment: Divine action enabling wholehearted obedience

themes.name: Petition → Obedience
themes.description: Requests for divine guidance enabling Torah fidelity
themes.comment: Imperative verbs (pone, deduc) precede covenantal obedience (custodiam)

themes.name: Faculty Alignment
themes.description: Reorientation of human capacities toward divine law
themes.comment: Heart (cor), mind (intellectum), and eyes (oculos) recalibrated to testimonies

themes.name: Aversion → Vivification
themes.description: Turning from vanity to find life in God's way
themes.comment: Double movement: 'turn away' (averte) and 'give life' (vivifica)

themes.name: Judicial Delight
themes.description: God's judgments as both joyful and equitable
themes.comment: Unexpected pairing: opprobrium (shame) with jucunda (pleasant judgments)

themes.name: Augustine: Lex Vivificans
themes.description: Law as living path rather than dead letter
themes.comment: 'In via tua vivifica me' shows law animated by grace (Enarrationes 118.33)

themes.name: Augustine: Oculus Cordis
themes.description: Spiritual vision purified for divine contemplation
themes.comment: Eyes turned from vanity (Conf. VII.21) to see via justificationum

themes.name: Mercy → Salvation
themes.comment: Mercy (v.41) precedes and enables the keeping of law (v.44)

themes.name: Hope → Vindication
themes.comment: Double hope (speravi/supersperavi) confronts reproach (exprobrantibus)

themes.name: Truth → Eternity
themes.comment: 'Utterly' (usquequaque) modifies both truth-keeping and eternal scope

themes.name: Freedom → Proclamation
themes.comment: Width (latitudine) of movement parallels royal confidence

themes.name: Love → Gesture
themes.comment: Hand-raising (levavi) completes the meditation-practice cycle

themes.name: Augustine: Misericordia Subjunctiva
themes.comment: Subjunctives (veniat/auferas) show grace-dependent obedience (Enarrationes 118.41)

themes.name: Augustine: Supersperatio
themes.comment: Super-abundant hope (supersperavi) amid reproach (Sermon 32.12)

themes.name: Teresa: Manus Orantis
themes.comment: Physical gesture (levavi) manifests 'Nada te turbe' abandon (Interior Castle V.3)

themes.name: Covenantal Promises
themes.description: God's word as source of hope and life-giving comfort
themes.comment: The psalmist anchors hope in God's remembered promises

themes.name: Resistance and Eternity
themes.description: Steadfast obedience amid evil with eternal perspective
themes.comment: Contrast between present wickedness and God's eternal judgments

themes.name: Exhaustion and Joy
themes.description: Spiritual weariness transformed through joyful obedience
themes.comment: Paradox of finding song in God's statutes during exile

themes.name: Nocturnal Fidelity
themes.comment: Devotion expressed through vigilant nighttime observance

themes.name: Augustine: Memory as Sacrament
themes.description: Remembrance as active participation in divine reality
themes.comment: Nocturnal remembrance is sacramental communion with God

themes.name: Augustine: Lex Vivificans
themes.description: God's law as living, active, and life-giving force
themes.comment: God's word operates as resurrection power in the soul

themes.name: Covenantal Commitment
themes.comment: Active choice to make God's law one's portion (v.57) and identity (v.63)

themes.name: Prayerful Dependence
themes.comment: Appeals to mercy (vv.58,64) and nocturnal worship (v.62)

themes.name: Perseverance Amid Opposition
themes.comment: Encirclement by sinners (v.61) contrasted with resolve (v.60)

themes.name: Communal Piety
themes.comment: Identification with God-fearers (v.63) and global mercy (v.64)

themes.name: Augustine: Nocturnal Conversion
themes.description: Night as time for spiritual turning
themes.comment: Parallel between v.59's conversion and v.62's midnight rising

themes.name: Augustine: Mercy and Justice
themes.comment: Grace (v.58) precedes instruction in righteousness (v.64)

themes.name: Divine Pedagogy
themes.comment: Divine goodness (v.65) linked to teaching (v.66) and humbling (v.71)

themes.name: Theological Paradox
themes.comment: Humbling (v.71) and pride's opposition (v.69) become means of learning

themes.name: Comparative Value
themes.comment: God's law valued above precious metals (v.72)

themes.name: Contrast of Hearts
themes.comment: Proud hearts curdled (v.70) vs. devoted meditation (v.70)

themes.name: Augustine: Humble Learning
themes.comment: Sin (v.67) precedes humility that enables learning

themes.name: Augustine: Ordered Love
themes.comment: Proper love hierarchy: God's word > earthly riches

themes.name: Divine Craftsmanship
themes.description: God as creator and instructor of humanity
themes.comment: Creator-creation relationship (v.73) demands illumination

themes.name: Communal Joy
themes.comment: Mutual recognition of hope in God's word (v.74)

themes.name: Pedagogy of Suffering
themes.comment: Humiliation through truth (v.75) as formative

themes.name: Merciful Consolation
themes.comment: Mercy-life connection (vv.76-77) through meditation

themes.name: Antithetical Community
themes.comment: Shame for oppressors (v.78) vs. solidarity with God-fearers (v.79)

themes.name: Heart Purity
themes.comment: Blameless heart as protection from shame (v.80)

themes.name: Augustine: Creator-Redeemer
themes.comment: God shapes physically (v.73) and spiritually (v.80)

themes.name: Augustine: Two Cities
themes.comment: Earthly shame vs. heavenly justification

themes.name: Desperate Longing
themes.description: Physical and spiritual exhaustion awaiting God's intervention
themes.comment: Bodily metaphors (eyes/soul) for spiritual thirst

themes.name: Suffering Imagery
themes.comment: Wineskin/frost symbolize fragility; 'almost destroyed' (v.87)

themes.name: Cry for Justice
themes.description: Appeals for divine judgment against persecutors
themes.comment: Direct questions to God about timing of justice (v.84)

themes.name: Truth vs Falsehood
themes.description: Contrast between God's commands and human lies
themes.comment: 'False tales' (fabulationes) vs 'all Your commandments are truth'

themes.name: Covenantal Faithfulness
themes.comment: Double negation emphasizes commitment (vv.83,87)

themes.name: Life from Mercy
themes.description: Final plea grounded in God's character
themes.comment: Climax: 'Revive me according to Your mercy' (v.88)

themes.name: Augustine: Suffering as Remembrance
themes.comment: Frostbitten wineskin (v.83) paradoxically preserves memory

themes.name: Augustine: Mercy Precedes Obedience
themes.comment: 'Revive me... that I may keep' (v.88) shows grace-first logic

themes.name: Eternal Foundations
themes.description: God's word as enduring cosmic reality
themes.comment: Creation established through divine speech

themes.name: Divine Ordinance
themes.comment: Nature's submission contrasts with human rebellion

themes.name: Law as Lifeline
themes.comment: Torah study as antidote to spiritual death

themes.name: Covenantal Identity
themes.comment: Mutual possession expressed through law-keeping

themes.name: Enemy Contrast
themes.comment: Opposition highlighting divine wisdom

themes.name: Boundless Commandment
themes.comment: Paradox of perfect law exceeding human limits

themes.name: Augustine: Eternal Word
themes.description: Christ as the abiding divine utterance
themes.comment: Johannine connection (John 1:1)

themes.name: Augustine: Law and Grace
themes.comment: Grace-enabled obedience to life-giving law

themes.name: Love for God's Law
themes.description: Deep affection and meditation on divine commandments
themes.comment: Emotional and intellectual engagement with Torah

themes.name: Wisdom Superiority
themes.description: Divine law provides understanding surpassing human teachers
themes.comment: Divine wisdom exceeds even elders and teachers

themes.name: Sensory Delight
themes.comment: Taste imagery for God's words

themes.name: Radical Rejection
themes.description: Understanding leads to complete opposition to evil
themes.comment: Cognitive understanding produces moral revulsion

themes.name: Divine Pedagogy
themes.comment: Law makes wise beyond normal education

themes.name: Two Ways Contrast
themes.description: Clear dichotomy between God's way and evil path
themes.comment: Classic wisdom literature theme

themes.name: Augustine: Sweetness of Truth
themes.description: Sensory delight as metaphor for spiritual truth
themes.comment: Contrast between honey-sweet words and hated iniquity

themes.name: Augustine: Illuminated Understanding
themes.comment: Grace grants understanding surpassing human teachers

themes.name: Light → Vows
themes.comment: God's word as light (lucerna) precedes and empowers human vows (juravi)

themes.name: Humility → Teaching
themes.comment: Utter humiliation (usquequaque) creates space for life-giving teaching

themes.name: Protection → Steadfastness
themes.comment: Soul in God's hands (manibus) prevents straying from commands

themes.name: Inheritance → Commitment
themes.comment: Testimonies as perpetual heritage (hereditate) inspire heart-inclining

themes.name: Augustine: Incarnate Light
themes.description: Christ as the walking Word enabling vows
themes.comment: 'Lamp to feet' signifies Christ's embodied guidance (Sermon 126)

themes.name: Augustine: Humilitas Docibilis
themes.comment: God teaches only in the valley of humility (Enarrationes 118.25)

themes.name: Augustine: Inclinated Eschatology
themes.comment: Grace inclines the heart toward its true homeland (Conf. XIII.9)

themes.name: Cry in Distress
themes.description: Initial plea to God in time of trouble
themes.comment: Opening cry that establishes the psalm's supplicatory tone

themes.name: Protection from Deceit
themes.description: Request for deliverance from dishonest speech
themes.comment: Focus on protection from verbal harm

themes.name: Punishment of Deceivers
themes.description: Rhetorical question about divine justice against liars
themes.comment: Implied expectation of retributive justice

themes.name: Divine Arsenal
themes.description: Imagery of God's weapons against the wicked
themes.comment: Military metaphors for divine judgment

themes.name: Augsutine: The ‘Heu’ of Exile
themes.description: The psalmist’s cry of lament, interpreted by Augustine as the voice of sinful humanity’s exile from God
themes.comment: Augustine links this to the soul’s 'groaning' for redemption (Enarr. Ps. 119.5). The Cedar reference (Genesis 25:13) underscores exile among the unfaithful.

themes.name: Peace-Seeker's Dilemma
themes.description: Conflict between desire for peace and experience of hatred
themes.comment: Tension between peaceful intent and hostile environment

themes.name: Unprovoked Hostility
themes.description: Experience of being attacked despite peaceful words
themes.comment: Final complaint about unjust persecution

themes.name: Augustine: The Fire of Charity
themes.description: The desolating coals (carbonibus desolatoriis) purify like the fire of divine love
themes.comment: Enarrationes in Psalmos 119.5

themes.name: Augustine: Interior Ascent
themes.description: The mountains signify spiritual ascent—toward the apostles, saints, and ultimately Christ. The help we seek begins in the heart's upward turn.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 120.1 – Augustine reads 'montes' as spiritual authorities and the interior elevation of the soul.

themes.name: Divine Help from the Creator
themes.description: True help comes not from earth but from the Lord who made heaven and earth.
themes.comment: Foundational trust in God's creative authority as helper.

themes.name: Unfailing Vigilance
themes.description: God never slumbers; His guardianship is ceaseless and perfect.
themes.comment: Contrast with human watchfulness—God protects Israel tirelessly.

themes.name: Personal Protection
themes.description: God’s protection is personal, present, and proximate—like a shield on your right hand.
themes.comment: Imagery of God as your shadow or shield beside you.

themes.name: Cosmic Shelter
themes.description: God protects against cosmic dangers—sun by day, moon by night.
themes.comment: Poetic depiction of full-spectrum protection from all celestial forces.

themes.name: Spiritual Preservation
themes.description: God guards not only the body but also the soul from evil.
themes.comment: Inner security and moral integrity under divine custody.

themes.name: Lifelong Guardianship
themes.description: From now and forever, God oversees your every movement—going out and coming in.
themes.comment: The Psalm’s closing vision of comprehensive, eternal care.

themes.name: Pilgrimage Joy
themes.description: Joyful anticipation of going to the house of the Lord in communal worship.
themes.comment: Celebration of the journey toward God's house.

themes.name: Sacred Arrival
themes.description: The pilgrims have arrived and stand in the holy precincts of Jerusalem.
themes.comment: Physical and spiritual arrival in the sacred center.

themes.name: Jerusalem as Divine City
themes.description: Jerusalem is praised as a unified, built-up city symbolizing divine order.
themes.comment: City image as theological symbol of unity and stability.

themes.name: Covenantal Worship
themes.description: The tribes ascend for worship and covenantal testimony.
themes.comment: Liturgical participation in Israel’s identity.

themes.name: Justice and Kingship
themes.description: The city hosts thrones of judgment rooted in Davidic rule.
themes.comment: Jerusalem as seat of righteous governance.

themes.name: Prayer for Peace
themes.description: Exhortation to pray for the peace and prosperity of Jerusalem.
themes.comment: Spiritual and material well-being of the city desired.

themes.name: Security and Strength
themes.description: Blessings of peace and abundance in the city's towers and strength.
themes.comment: Images of fortified flourishing.

themes.name: Brotherly Peace
themes.description: Desire for peace for the sake of community and kinship.
themes.comment: Relational peace as a communal virtue.

themes.name: Worshipful Pursuit of Good
themes.description: Love for God's house motivates the pursuit of the city's good.
themes.comment: Liturgical devotion spilling into civic love.

themes.name: Upward Gaze
themes.description: The psalmist lifts eyes to God in heaven, expressing dependence
themes.comment: Physical gesture symbolizing spiritual reliance

themes.name: Servile Devotion
themes.description: Simile of servants’ eyes fixed on their masters’ hands
themes.comment: Metaphor for total attentiveness to divine providence

themes.name: Persistent Plea
themes.description: Unwavering focus on God 'until He has mercy'
themes.comment: Implies patient but urgent expectation

themes.name: Double Cry for Mercy
themes.comment: Liturgical refrain intensifying the appeal

themes.name: Social Humiliation
themes.description: Description of scorn from the arrogant
themes.comment: Opposition defined by pride vs. the psalmist’s humility

themes.name: Augustine: Eyes of the Heart
themes.description: ‘Levavi oculos’ signifies the soul’s ascent beyond bodily sight
themes.comment: Enarrationes in Psalmos 121.1

themes.name: Divine Presence as Salvation
themes.description: The repeated 'nisi quia Dominus' emphasizes God's essential presence in Israel's survival.
themes.comment: If the Lord were not with us—Israel owes survival to divine companionship.

themes.name: Human Threats
themes.description: Violent imagery of people rising up to devour the faithful.
themes.comment: Imagery of being swallowed alive by enemies.

themes.name: Flood and Wrath
themes.description: God protects against overwhelming forces likened to water and wrath.
themes.comment: Waters symbolize chaos and destruction fueled by rage.

themes.name: Snare and Escape
themes.description: Like a bird escaping a trap, the soul is freed from enemies' schemes.
themes.comment: Striking imagery of divine rescue from cunning dangers.

themes.name: Divine Creator as Helper
themes.description: Final affirmation of trust in the name of the Lord, Creator of heaven and earth.
themes.comment: Psalm ends on a confident declaration of cosmic support.

themes.name: Steadfast Trust
themes.description: Those who trust in the Lord are as immovable as Mount Zion.
themes.comment: Imagery of unshakable faith rooted in a sacred location.

themes.name: Protective Encirclement
themes.description: God surrounds His people just as mountains surround Jerusalem.
themes.comment: Topographical metaphor for divine protection.

themes.name: Moral Safeguard
themes.description: God will not let the wicked rule over the righteous lest they be led into iniquity.
themes.comment: Spiritual separation and the prevention of moral compromise.

themes.name: Prayer for the Righteous
themes.description: Blessing is requested for the good and upright in heart.
themes.comment: Invoking divine goodness upon the morally aligned.

themes.name: Judgment and Peace
themes.description: The deviants and evildoers are led away, while peace is declared upon Israel.
themes.comment: Final eschatological contrast: judgment for the wicked, peace for God’s people.

themes.name: Restoration of Zion
themes.description: God’s turning of Zion’s captivity brought about collective joy and consolation.
themes.comment: Opening line emphasizes divine reversal of fortune.

themes.name: Overflowing Joy
themes.description: Joy expressed through mouth and language; emotional reaction to divine restoration.
themes.comment: Exuberant reaction described with bodily imagery.

themes.name: Witness of the Nations
themes.description: The greatness of God's actions becomes visible to the nations.
themes.comment: Public acknowledgment of God's deeds beyond Israel.

themes.name: Prayer for Continued Restoration
themes.description: The psalmist asks God to continue His redemptive work, like desert rains.
themes.comment: Petition framed with geographical simile (southern streams).

themes.name: Sowing in Tears, Reaping in Joy
themes.description: Those who suffer now in sorrow will later rejoice in harvest.
themes.comment: Agricultural metaphor for emotional and spiritual transformation.

themes.name: Pilgrimage of Suffering and Return
themes.description: A poetic journey from weeping to rejoicing, bearing the fruit of endurance.
themes.comment: Pilgrimage movement language emphasizes faithful perseverance.

themes.name: Vain Labor Without God
themes.description: Human efforts in building or guarding are futile without God's participation.
themes.comment: Foundational theme: 'Unless the Lord builds the house...'

themes.name: Fruitless Anxiety
themes.description: Early rising and toiling in sorrow is empty without divine blessing.
themes.comment: Contrast between self-reliant striving and God’s rest.

themes.name: God’s Gift of Sleep and Family
themes.description: The Lord grants sleep to His beloved and gives children as a heritage.
themes.comment: Rest and progeny as divine blessings.

themes.name: Children as Defensive Strength
themes.description: Children are like arrows in a warrior’s hand—strength for the future.
themes.comment: Military metaphor showing familial empowerment.

themes.name: Public Honor and Security
themes.description: The man with many children will not be shamed when facing his enemies.
themes.comment: Social vindication through familial abundance and dignity.

themes.name: Fear of the Lord and Right Living
themes.description: Blessing begins with those who fear the Lord and walk in His ways.
themes.comment: Foundational condition for the blessings that follow.

themes.name: Fruit of Labor
themes.description: The work of one’s hands will yield sustenance and well-being.
themes.comment: Earthly blessing tied to faithful diligence.

themes.name: Domestic Abundance
themes.description: The home is portrayed as flourishing: wife as vine, children as olive shoots.
themes.comment: Rich family imagery celebrating household fruitfulness.

themes.name: Covenantal Blessing
themes.description: The man who fears the Lord is blessed with this abundance.
themes.comment: Repetition reinforces the blessing tied to fear of the Lord.

themes.name: Zion and Lifelong Prosperity
themes.description: Blessings come from Zion, extending to the prosperity of Jerusalem and one’s lifetime.
themes.comment: Spatial and temporal expansion of the blessing—from household to holy city.

themes.name: Generational Continuity and Peace
themes.description: The final hope is to see one’s grandchildren and the peace of Israel.
themes.comment: Closes with generational vision and national peace.

themes.name: Enduring Affliction
themes.description: Israel recalls long-standing opposition and attack from its early days.
themes.comment: Repeated suffering is emphasized—but without defeat.

themes.name: Burden of Wickedness
themes.description: The wicked are described as having worked oppression across Israel’s back.
themes.comment: Graphic image of prolonged exploitation.

themes.name: Divine Justice
themes.description: The Lord defeats the wicked, cutting off their strength and dominion.
themes.comment: God intervenes decisively against the oppressors.

themes.name: Reversal of the Wicked
themes.description: Enemies of Zion are shamed and turned backward.
themes.comment: Judgment results in public reversal and disgrace.

themes.name: Withering Futility
themes.description: The wicked are likened to roof-grass that dries up prematurely.
themes.comment: They have no lasting root or fruit.

themes.name: Fruitless Effort
themes.description: Their efforts yield nothing worth harvesting or carrying.
themes.comment: No one benefits from their work.

themes.name: Absence of Blessing
themes.description: The wicked are passed over without any greeting of blessing.
themes.comment: No one speaks peace or divine favor over them.

themes.name: Cry from the Depths
themes.description: The psalmist begins with a desperate plea from the lowest place of need.
themes.comment: A prayer launched from the symbolic depths of suffering or sin.

themes.name: Prayerful Appeal
themes.description: A heartfelt call for God to hear and attend to the supplicant’s voice.
themes.comment: Layered plea for divine attentiveness and mercy.

themes.name: Recognition of Guilt
themes.description: Acknowledgment of human iniquity and unworthiness before divine justice.
themes.comment: No one can stand before God if sins are accounted.

themes.name: Hope in Mercy and Word
themes.description: Despite guilt, the psalmist waits for God's mercy and trusts in His word.
themes.comment: Patience, waiting, and reliance on the Lord’s promise.

themes.name: Communal Invitation to Hope
themes.description: The entire people of Israel are called to wait in faith for the Lord.
themes.comment: Israel is summoned to collective, persistent hope.

themes.name: Abundant Redemption
themes.description: God is portrayed as rich in mercy and redemption.
themes.comment: Confidence in divine fullness and capacity to forgive.

themes.name: Promise of Deliverance
themes.description: God Himself will redeem Israel from all sin.
themes.comment: Final assurance of total salvation through the Lord.

themes.name: Rejection of Pride
themes.description: The psalmist denies any exaltation of heart, eyes, or ambition.
themes.comment: A declaration of humility and distance from greatness or vanity.

themes.name: Interior Humility
themes.description: Even in feelings, the soul is subdued and peaceful like a weaned child.
themes.comment: Powerful image of spiritual calm, not striving or restlessness.

themes.name: Communal Hope in God
themes.description: Israel is invited to place lasting hope in the Lord.
themes.comment: Final line turns personal stillness into collective trust.

themes.name: Augustine: Holy Humility
themes.description: The psalmist's refusal to walk in greatness is true spiritual humility—Augustine sees this as the virtue by which all other virtues ascend.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 130.1 – Augustine: 'What lifts the soul is not pride but humility. The greater you want to be, the lower you must stoop.'

themes.name: Augustine: Weaned Soul as Peaceful Soul
themes.description: Augustine sees the weaned child as the image of a soul detached from worldly ambition and resting in quiet trust before God.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 130.2 – The soul is quieted like a weaned child: no longer crying for milk, but resting on the mother’s lap in peace.

themes.name: David’s Humble Vow
themes.description: David humbly vows not to rest until he finds a dwelling place for the Lord.
themes.comment: Opening remembrance of David’s humility and dedication to securing a resting place for God.

themes.name: Seeking and Entering God's Presence
themes.description: The ark is discovered and honored; the people enter and worship in God's dwelling.
themes.comment: A sacred procession from hearing about the ark to entering God's presence.

themes.name: Priestly Joy and Messianic Plea
themes.description: The people pray for priestly righteousness and appeal for God’s favor on His anointed.
themes.comment: Petition for priestly blessing and the Messiah’s honor, rooted in David’s legacy.

themes.name: Divine Promise to David
themes.description: God swears to establish David’s lineage forever, conditioned on faithfulness.
themes.comment: Unbreakable divine covenant with David’s house and throne.

themes.name: Zion as God’s Chosen Dwelling
themes.description: God chooses Zion forever and promises to bless its people and priests.
themes.comment: Zion is the eternal site of God’s presence and blessing for the community.

themes.name: Messianic Glory and Final Victory
themes.description: God exalts David’s power and prepares light for His Christ, while enemies are shamed.
themes.comment: Messianic hope fulfilled as God glorifies His anointed and defeats opposition.

themes.name: Augustine: Christ as Tabernacle
themes.description: David’s longing for a place for the Lord is fulfilled in Christ, who is both the Temple and the resting place of God in humanity.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 131 – The Word made flesh is where God comes to dwell among us.

themes.name: Augustine: Zion as the Church
themes.description: Zion is chosen by God not just as a city, but as the figure of the eternal Church where He dwells and blesses forever.
themes.comment: Zion is the heavenly city, the Church filled with saints and Christ’s light.

themes.name: Augustine: Anointing as Christ
themes.description: The anointing oil flowing from Aaron’s head is a figure of Christ, the Anointed One, through whom divine blessing flows from the head (Christ) to the body (the Church).
themes.comment: En. Ps. 132 – Augustine sees the anointing as a metaphor for Christ's grace descending upon the unity of the Church.

themes.name: Augustine: Dew as Holy Spirit
themes.description: The dew of Hermon represents the Holy Spirit descending on the Church (Mount Zion), bringing divine refreshment and eternal life.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 132 – Augustine: As dew brings fruitfulness to earth, so the Spirit brings fruit to the Church.

themes.name: Fraternal Unity
themes.description: Unity among brethren is declared good and joyful.
themes.comment: Opens with a vision of blessed communal harmony.

themes.name: Priestly Anointing and Sacred Flow
themes.description: Unity is likened to anointing oil flowing from Aaron’s head to his garments.
themes.comment: Priestly imagery conveys blessing flowing from head to body.

themes.name: Dew and Blessing from Zion
themes.description: Divine blessing descends like Hermon’s dew on Zion, bringing eternal life.
themes.comment: Natural imagery illustrates God's commanded blessing and life.

themes.name: Augustine: Night Praise as Spiritual Watchfulness
themes.description: Augustine interprets the nighttime worship as the vigilant life of the Church amidst the darkness of the world, blessing God even when others sleep.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 133 – 'In noctibus' signals the faithful who keep watch and remain spiritually alert.

themes.name: Augustine: Zion Blessing and Creation
themes.description: The blessing from Zion is the blessing of the Church, and the Creator who made heaven and earth is the same who blesses through Christ.
themes.comment: En. Ps. 133 – Blessing flows from the Church (Zion), grounded in the Creator of all things.

themes.name: Call to Night Worship
themes.description: Servants of the Lord are summoned to bless God by night in His house.
themes.comment: Liturgical call to continual temple praise during the night watches.

themes.name: Blessing from the Creator
themes.description: The Lord who made heaven and earth blesses from Zion.
themes.comment: Final blessing anchors divine generosity in creation and sacred place.

themes.name: Personal Praise
themes.comment: Complete knowledge, Deep understanding

themes.name: Human Experience
themes.comment: From sitting to rising - encompassing all of life

themes.name: Divine Scrutiny
themes.description: God's thorough examination of the individual
themes.comment: Testing and searching of the heart

themes.name: Divine Foreknowledge
themes.description: God's complete foresight of human paths
themes.comment: All ways and paths are known beforehand

themes.name: Creative Power
themes.description: God's formative action in human life
themes.comment: Formation and purposeful placement

themes.name: Temporal Knowledge
themes.comment: From ancient times to the future

themes.name: Divine Knowledge
themes.description: The wonderful nature of God's understanding
themes.comment: Beyond human comprehension

themes.name: Divine Presence
themes.comment: From heaven to hell, God is present

themes.name: Human Limitation
themes.comment: Inability to escape or fully comprehend

themes.name: Omnipresence
themes.comment: From highest heaven to deepest hell

themes.name: Extreme Locations
themes.description: God's presence in the farthest places
themes.comment: Uttermost parts of the sea

themes.name: Divine Guidance
themes.comment: God's hand guides and directs

themes.name: Divine Protection
themes.description: God's secure holding of the believer
themes.comment: Right hand as symbol of strength and protection

themes.name: Divine Illumination
themes.comment: Darkness becomes light in God's presence

themes.name: Darkness Transformed
themes.description: The overcoming of darkness by divine light
themes.comment: Night shines like day before God

themes.name: Divine Formation
themes.description: God's intimate knowledge of human development
themes.comment: From conception to birth and beyond

themes.name: Awe and Wonder
themes.comment: Fearful and wonderful works of God

themes.name: Divine Knowledge
themes.comment: Sees even unformed substance and future days

themes.name: Creative Sovereignty
themes.description: God's control over time and development
themes.comment: Forms both days and human life

themes.name: Divine Friendship
themes.comment: God's friends are highly valued

themes.name: Abundant Blessing
themes.comment: Numerous as sand on the shore

themes.name: Divine Judgment
themes.comment: Separation from bloodthirsty men

themes.name: Righteous Hatred
themes.comment: Complete rejection of God's enemies

themes.name: Divine Examination
themes.comment: Invitation for God to search the heart

themes.name: Eternal Guidance
themes.comment: Lead me in the way everlasting

themes.name: Identification with God
themes.comment: Emotional alignment with God's values

themes.name: Heart Knowledge
themes.comment: God's complete knowledge of the heart
